page.title: 09The Hamilton Local Plan 3
page.content:
A modified local plan of the proposed Hamilton development was published in 1984 stressing the need for around 4 000 homes in Leicester. The last date for objections was Friday 14th June 1985.
The modified plan would cover a smaller area than the original plan but would still swallow up a great deal of grade two agricultural land. The people living in the area are very concerned at the development and even local builders have voiced their concern. It seems to be the feeling that the Hamilton development would be too similar to the unpopular Beaumont Leys development in the north-west of the city. There are concerns about loss of farmland, countryside and even flooding along the River Soar.
